result.execSummary:
The defendant Shurone V Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Shurone V Carter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Shurone V Carter was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shurone V Carter

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief

Court reporte Teri Groves. Defendant in court with Attorney Sasa G Johnen.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties dismiss the felony count in this case and proceed on misdemeanor counts. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #2 and 3.

COUNT #1      
Court I/S a sentence of: 
-Serve 3 months in the DCJ, with Huber, cc to Dane County Case 21CF1014

-Stayed for 2 years probation cc to Dane County Case 21CF1014

CONDITIONS:
-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on probation
 
-Days credit if revoked: Zero

DE advised of post-conviction rights

[Jaime D.]
Def appeared for drug screening. Not eligible referred to attorney for DPU.

Status conference on March 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
Parties stipulated to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing. 
Trial Judge - Br 17

01:55 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Amy M Johnson.  Cecilia E DeMarco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Defendant referred for screening.  Status conference scheduled for April 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Status conference scheduled for March 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
